pt.ptcris.utils

Class ORCIDHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.ptcris.utils.ORCIDHelper

  • public class ORCIDHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    An helper to simplify the use of the low-level ORCID client. Provides support for asynchronous communication with ORCID although it is only active for GET requests due to resource limitations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      • client

        public final ORCIDClient client
        The client used to communicate with ORCID. Defines the ORCID user profile being managed and the Member API id being user to source works.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllWorkSummaries

        public java.util.List<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary> getAllWorkSummaries()
                                                                                  throws org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException
        Retrieves the entire set of work summaries from the set ORCID profile that have at least an external identifier set. Merges each ORCID group into a single summary, following groupToWork(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.activities.WorkGroup).
        Returns:
        the set of work summaries in the set ORCID profile
        Throws:
        org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException - if the communication with ORCID fails

      • getSourcedWorkSummaries

        public java.util.List<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary> getSourcedWorkSummaries()
                                                                                      throws org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException
        Retrieves the entire set of work summaries in the ORCID profile whose source is the Member API id defined in the ORCID client.
        Returns:
        the set of work summaries in the ORCID profile for the defined source
        Throws:
        org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException - if the communication with ORCID fails

      • getFullWork

        public void getFullWork(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary mergedWork,
               java.util.Map<java.math.BigInteger,java.lang.Object> cb)
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Asynchronously gets a full work from an ORCID profile. The resulting work contains every external identifier set in the input work summary, because the summary resulted from the merging of a group, but the retrieve full work is a single work. It also clears the put-code, since at this level they represent the local identifier.
        Parameters:
        mergedWork - the work summary representing a merged group
        cb - the callback object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the merged work is null
        See Also:
        ORCIDClient.getWork(BigInteger)

      • getFullWork

        public org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work getFullWork(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary mergedWork)
                                                   throws org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException,
                                                          java.lang.NullPointerException
        Synchronously gets a full work from an ORCID profile. The resulting work contains every external identifier set in the input work summary, because the summary resulted from the merging of a group, but the retrieve full work is a single work. It also clears the put-code, since at this level they represent the local identifier.
        Parameters:
        mergedWork - the work summary representing a merged group
        Returns:
        the full work retrieved from ORCID
        Throws:
        org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException - if communication with the ORCID API fails
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the merged work is null
        See Also:
        ORCIDClient.getWork(BigInteger)

        public java.math.BigInteger addWork(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work work)

                                    java.lang.NullPointerException

        Returns:

        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the work is null

      • updateWork

        public void updateWork(java.math.BigInteger remotePutcode,
              org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work updatedWork)
                throws org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException,
                       java.lang.NullPointerException
        Synchronously updates a work in an ORCID profile.
        Parameters:
        remotePutcode - the put-code of the remote ORCID work that will be updated
        updatedWork - the new state of the work that will be updated
        Throws:
        org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException - if communication with the ORCID API fails
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either parameter is null
        See Also:
        ORCIDClient.updateWork(BigInteger, Work)

      • waitWorkers

        public boolean waitWorkers()
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits for all active asynchronous workers communicating with ORCID to finish (if multi-threading is enabled, otherwise it is always true).
        Returns:
        whether the workers finished before the timeout
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the process was interrupted

      • getExternalIdsDiff

        public static java.util.Map<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work,ExternalIdsDiff> getExternalIdsDiff(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary work,
                                                                                       java.util.Collection<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work> works)
                                                                                                throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Calculates the symmetric difference of external identifiers between a work and a set of works. Works that do not match (i.e., no identifier is common) are ignored.
        Parameters:
        work - the work summary to be compared with other works
        works - the set of works against which the work summary is compared
        Returns:
        The symmetric difference of external identifiers between work and works
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either of the parameters is null

      • hasNewIDs

        public static boolean hasNewIDs(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work preWork,
                org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary posWork)
        Checks whether a work is already up to date regarding another one, i.e., whether a work has the same external identifiers as another one. This test is expected to be used by the import algorithms, where only new external identifiers are to be considered.
        Parameters:
        preWork - The potentially out of date work.
        posWork - The up to date work.
        Returns:
        true if all the UIDs between the two works are the same, false otherwise.

      • isUpToDate

        public static boolean isUpToDate(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work preWork,
                 org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary posWork)
        Checks whether a work is already up to date regarding another one, considering the external identifiers and additional meta-data. This test is expected to be used by the export algorithms, where the meta-data is expected to be up-to-date on the remote profile.
        Parameters:
        preWork - the potentially out of date work
        posWork - the up to date work
        Returns:
        true if all the external identifiers and the meta-data between the two works are the same, false otherwise.

      • isUpToDate

        public static boolean isUpToDate(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work preWork,
                 org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work posWork)
        Checks whether a work is already up to date regarding another one, considering the external identifiers and additional meta-data.
        Parameters:
        preWork - the potentially out of date work
        posWork - the up to date work
        Returns:
        true if all the external identifiers and the meta-data between the two works are the same, false otherwise.

      • testMinimalQuality

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> testMinimalQuality(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work work)
                                                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Tests whether a work has minimal quality to be synchronized, by inspecting its meta-data, returns the detected invalid fields. The considered fields are: external identifiers, title, publication date (year), work type. All these meta-data is available in work summaries. The publication date is not necessary for data sets and research techniques. TODO: contributors are not being considered as they are not contained in the summaries.
        Parameters:
        work - the work to test for quality
        Returns:
        the set of invalid fields
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the work is null

      • testMinimalQuality

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> testMinimalQuality(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary work)
                                                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Tests whether a work has minimal quality to be synchronized, by inspecting its meta-data, returns the detected invalid fields. The considered fields are: external identifiers, title, publication date (year), work type. All these meta-data is available in work summaries. The publication date is not necessary for data sets and research techniques. TODO: contributors are not being considered as they are not contained in the summaries.
        Parameters:
        work - the work to test for quality
        Returns:
        the set of invalid fields
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the work is null

      • tryMinimalQuality

        public static void tryMinimalQuality(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work work)
                              throws InvalidWorkException
        Tests whether a work has minimal quality to be synchronized, by inspecting its meta-data. Throws an exception if the test fails. The considered fields are: external identifiers, title, publication date (year), work type. All these meta-data is available in work summaries. TODO: contributors are not being considered as they are not contained in the summaries.
        Parameters:
        work - the work to test for quality
        Throws:
        InvalidWorkException - if the quality test fails, containing the reasons for failing
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the work is null

      • tryMinimalQuality

        public static void tryMinimalQuality(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary work)
                              throws InvalidWorkException
        Tests whether a work has minimal quality to be synchronized, by inspecting its meta-data. Throws an exception if the test fails. The considered fields are: external identifiers, title, publication date (year), work type. All these meta-data is available in work summaries. TODO: contributors are not being considered as they are not contained in the summaries.
        Parameters:
        work - the work to test for quality
        Throws:
        InvalidWorkException - if the quality test fails, containing the reasons for failing
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the work is null
